Polkadot Punks [twitter](https://twitter.com/polkadot_punks?t=roM6EGLp6HfjS3jrLjgDcg&s=09)
history.title: Open-source Mint Dapp and Hub wallet for Asset hub

history.content:
**NFT Mint (Open-source NFT Mint Dapp) Budget: 300 KSM**

Chaos labs is building a NFT project called Polkadot Punks and we have successfully implemented our V1 Mint Dapp on Polkadot Asset Hub [Checkout Mint Dapp](https://polkadot-punks.vercel.app/)

Further Chaos labs is developing a mint dapp which will be open-source on Asset hub

supporting

1.  Whitelist mint **cost: 100ksm** : whitelist mint will allow selecting specific wallet for the public mint to overcome mint botting risks  and community guaranteed mint
2.  Free mint **cost: 100ksm** : Free mint is the one the most popular thing currently in NFT so we wanted to add this into the asset hub so there will be variations and each nft minter will only have to pay the mint fee for set metadata which is on-chain and no any extra fees
3.  Revealable mint **cost: 100ksm** :  Reveablable NFT mints are Trending in the nft space where nfts first gets minted then once the mint is done or after a set time the nft is revealed by setting it's metadata

**Asset pad (NFT Launchpad) Budget: 300KSM**

Asset pad is being built to support those creators who cannot code on their own that's why Asset pad will help them to launch their collection without any programming with the same features

1.  Whitelist mint cost: 100ksm : whitelist mint will allow selecting specific wallet for the public mint to overcome mint botting risks and community guaranteed mint
    
2.  Free mint cost: 100ksm : Free mint is the one the most popular thing currently in NFT so we wanted to add this into the asset hub so there will be variations and each nft minter will only have to pay the mint fee for set metadata which is on-chain and no any extra fees
    
3.  Revealable mint cost: 100ksm : Reveablable NFT mints are Trending in the nft space where nfts first gets minted then once the mint is done or after a set time the nft is revealed by setting it's metadata

**Major Differences between NFT mint Dapp and Asset Pad**

-   NFT mint Dapp : This is helpful when it comes to the customising the ui ux and many other things within the dapp so the nft project team can build what they want
-   Asset pad : It is helpful for those artists who don't have any developer experience so they can use our dapp to deploy their mint

**Hub wallet ( Wallet for Assets and NFTs on Asset Hub ) cost: 511ksm**

-   **NFTs cost: 250ksm** : On nft pallet we'll add all the feature like selling your nft by using your wallet only using list item on nft pallet buring buying offers swapping nfts and many more
-   **Assets cost: 250ksm** : On Asset pallet Hub wallet will support all Functionality like buring sending receving gifting and many more
-   **Quick Teleport on each Transaction** : Using this way we'll be able to teleport our dot , ksm to asset hub quickly on each transaction and won't have but our whole balance on asset hub

Thanks for reading this a single Aye can build a whole ecosystem on Asset Hub ❤️

Polkadot Punks [twitter](https://twitter.com/polkadot_punks?t=roM6EGLp6HfjS3jrLjgDcg&s=09)

items.title: OpenBrush 8-9, 11 milestone delivery
items.content:
Hey Polkadot & Kusama community!

We are happy to deliver our work on the [proposal](138) approved on the 23rd of March 2023 and are requesting a second allocation of funds for the development of 8-9, 11 milestones of OpenBrush.

## Context of delivery 

The purpose of this proposal is to grow the emerging WASM smart contracts field by developing the core infrastructure product OpenBrush. As Gavin mentioned in this CoinDesk article, WebAssembly is the future of smart contracts. Also, as mentioned in the approved WASM smart contracts bounty, smart contracts parachains lead the ecosystem in terms of market adoption. However, despite WASM tech having a lot to offer, it's not being widely used now simply because of the lack of proper tooling and ecosystem infrastructure products.

OpenBrush is a core infrastructure product, a starting point, and a base for every ink! dApp. Nineteen production-grade teams and three parachains currently use OpenBrush. This proposal is the delivery of the previously approved development of the successful product, proposing the most developer-needed features validated by market feedback.

Please note that we did additional research and have made the decision not to proceed with the planned and approved 12th milestone and are not requesting funding for it. However, we were forced to do some additional scope of work in order to fix unexpected issues after the Rust nightly toolchain's latest release. More details can be found in the delivery report.

## Delivery

You can find our delivery report here:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ff0CKjIFr\_Rr4jkAuiZhVoWvmjc5MU3MyxmaIclsc4E/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ff0CKjIFr_Rr4jkAuiZhVoWvmjc5MU3MyxmaIclsc4E/edit?usp=sharing)

The amount was calculated as follows: The remaining amount without the last milestone is $235200/2 - $67200 = $50400. Including the costs of out-of-scope work, the amount is $50400 + $10320 = $60720. 60720/19.489=3115.60367387

items.title: AIWeb3 Chinese Unit proposal II (爱Web3 中文社区提案 II)
items.content:
Dear DotSama community, GM/GN!

I am DrCAO, the Community Manager of the Polkadot parachain project, Parallel Finance. I also lead a Chinese community in Wagmedia, a member of the WagMedia committee, the director of the Centrifuge Chinese community, and an Ambassador for several Polkadot parachain projects such as Astar Network and Bifrost. Additionally, I'm a member of Chaos DAO. As the founder of the AIWeb3 community, I wish to share updates from the past six months and seek the renewal of the AIWeb3 community.

The mission of the AIWeb3 Chinese community is to nurture the community, enabling Chinese content creators to focus on content creation in DotSama. We aim to bridge different parachain projects and ensure the community receives the latest information about DotSama. This environment allows Chinese content creators to concentrate on research, producing high-quality content, which includes dubbing, translations, and original pieces centered around DotSama. Moreover, we are allocating more resources to support budding content creators, helping them to cultivate their audience and brand.

The AIWeb3 Chinese community caters to individuals passionate about the dotsama, Web3, and its long-term prospects. This includes content creators in Dotsama and its enthusiasts. The community believes in Web3 technology for the future, being open and honest, and always keep learning.

In the last half-year, backed by the Kusama treasury, because of the excellent content creators and community support, AIWeb3 surpassed our own expectations, executing all planned tasks and even extending beyond our initial mandate. We produced over 600 original pieces, completed 28 translations with 35 proofreadings, and created 4 top-tier dubbings. We welcomed 19 content creators into our fold, with 13 making at least one contribution. Their expertise spans from DeFi to NFTs, art design, and event organization.

We've fostered relationships with over 20 parachain teams, pitching 16 collaborative initiatives to garner additional support. We've forged partnerships with Neurolauncher, the community-driven NFT marketplace Bluez within the Astar ecosystem, and the decentralized platform, Frentube ([https://twitter.com/fren\_tube).](https://twitter.com/fren_tube\).) Our endeavors also encompass both in-person and online events.

As of August 1st, our official Twitter ([https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao](https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao) has 1993 followers. Our Discord server ([https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk](https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk) has 535 members, our Telegram group ([https://t.me/aiweb3dao](https://t.me/aiweb3dao) has 328 members, and our decentralized Polkaverse space ([https://polkaverse.com/10900](https://polkaverse.com/10900) has 173 posts. Our presence extends to a WeChat Official Account and a video channel, "爱Web3", each video averaging over 1k views. We've also developed a Discord bot enriched with AI capabilities, and an intriguing role-upgrade game centered on a book about Polkadot, still in progress. In conclusion, the treasury's support over the past six months enabled us to offer Web3 education, nurture content creators, consolidate the community, devise a Discord bot now utilized by other parachain teams, establish pivotal partnerships in DotSama, revitalize Chinese communities, and achieve much more!

our monthly report contains more updates:

July report:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-0raBj\_MQcNKmOZkgm439zenVvYzunZl3LCMb0DWwOA/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-0raBj_MQcNKmOZkgm439zenVvYzunZl3LCMb0DWwOA/edit?usp=sharing)

June report:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AvTcV66yGhpuPn-U-Te0Ic-z5XjBQhcPt9Kp1qGNkXQ/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AvTcV66yGhpuPn-U-Te0Ic-z5XjBQhcPt9Kp1qGNkXQ/edit?usp=sharing)

May report:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RaqfcUvt4QHa6v9AEXNs2s9YbON1xcnBhGGE5utvTkU/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RaqfcUvt4QHa6v9AEXNs2s9YbON1xcnBhGGE5utvTkU/edit?usp=sharing)

April report:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PVQFia8YDbB8yS\_VDSN\_rkTaJRXG1xxo8xVCdvZu-qs/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PVQFia8YDbB8yS_VDSN_rkTaJRXG1xxo8xVCdvZu-qs/edit?usp=sharing)

Feb-March report:  

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sfTYTHzPJMVSStFxCxsS9kWfszgqM1OxF58vbjhprMg/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sfTYTHzPJMVSStFxCxsS9kWfszgqM1OxF58vbjhprMg/edit?usp=sharing)

The Full English version proposal can be found here： 

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/194jzl3FZN4T8kZuUTRdQSaitUGwRbNjSpU3ww6Z4p\_0/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/194jzl3FZN4T8kZuUTRdQSaitUGwRbNjSpU3ww6Z4p_0/edit?usp=sharing)

We have posted our proposal in discussion for 2 weeks and got all positive feedback, we now hope to get your support, and I would be happy to answer any questions related to the proposal as well. I also  present the proposal in the AAG: 

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XZmkGo3tnrA](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XZmkGo3tnrA)

亲爱的DotSama社区，早上好/晚上好！

我是曹博士，Polkadot平行链项目Parallel Finance的社区经理，也是WagMedia中文社区的负责人，WagMedia委员会的委员，Centrifuge中文社区的负责人，以及Astar Network和Bifrost等多个Polkadot平行链项目的大使。此外，我还是Chaos DAO的成员。作为AIWeb3社区的创始人，我希望分享过去六个月AIWeb3社区的更新，并寻求社区和基金会对AIWeb3社区下一个半年的支持。

AIWeb3中文社区的使命是建设波卡社区，使中文内容创作者能够专注于DotSama的内容创作。我们的目标是连接不同的平行链项目，并确保社区能够获得最新信息。我们希望创建一种良好的环境使得中文内容创作者能欧集中精力进行内容创作和研究，生成高质量的内容，包括配音、翻译以及围绕DotSama的原创内容。此外，我们将分配更多资源来支持初创的内容创作者，帮助他们培养他们的观众和品牌。

AIWeb3中文社区欢迎对Polkadot生态系统、Web3及其长期前景充满激情的人。这包括与polkadot生态系统相关的内容创作者和polkadot爱好者。我们的社区建立在价值导向、长期投资策略、透明度、诚信和持续学习的基础之上。

在过去的半年中，在Kusama国库的支持下，AIWeb3的表现超出了我们自己的预期，由于我们优秀的创作者们和社区的支持，我们完成了所有计划的任务，甚至更多。我们制作了超过600个原创作品，完成了28次翻译和35次校对，以及4个高质量的配音。我们很高兴有19位内容创作者加入我们，其中13人至少做出了一次贡献。他们的专业知识囊括DeFi到NFT、艺术设计和组织活动等等。我们已经与超过20个平行链团队建立了关系，提出了16个合作倡议以获得额外的支持。我们与Neurolauncher、Astar生态系统中的社区驱动的NFT市场Bluez以及去中心化的平台Frentube ([https://twitter.com/fren\_tube)](https://twitter.com/fren_tube\)) 都建立了合作伙伴关系。我们也努力的开展线下和线上的活动。截至8月1日，我们的官方Twitter([https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao)](https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao\)) 拥有1993名关注者。我们的Discord服务器 ([https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk)](https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk\)) 有535名成员，我们的Telegram群组([https://t.me/aiweb3dao)有328名成员， 我们的去中心化Polkaverse空间(https://polkaverse.com/10900)](https://t.me/aiweb3dao\)有328名成员，我们的去中心化Polkaverse空间\(https://polkaverse.com/10900\)) 有173篇帖子。我们还有一个微信官方账户和一个视频频道：“爱Web3”，每个视频的平均观看次数超过1k。我们还推出了一个带有AI功能的Discord机器人，以及一个关于Polkadot的有趣的角色升级游戏，目前仍在进行中。总之，感谢国库在过去6个月的资金支持，我们不仅提供了web3教育，支持内容创作者，而且还建立了社区，开发了Discord机器人并被其他平行链项目采用，与DotSama建立了重要的合作伙伴关系，振兴了波卡中国社区，未来还有更多！

我们的月报包含有更多的更新:

2-3月月报:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sfTYTHzPJMVSStFxCxsS9kWfszgqM1OxF58vbjhprMg/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sfTYTHzPJMVSStFxCxsS9kWfszgqM1OxF58vbjhprMg/edit?usp=sharing)

4月月报:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PVQFia8YDbB8yS\_VDSN\_rkTaJRXG1xxo8xVCdvZu-qs/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PVQFia8YDbB8yS_VDSN_rkTaJRXG1xxo8xVCdvZu-qs/edit?usp=sharing)

5月月报:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RaqfcUvt4QHa6v9AEXNs2s9YbON1xcnBhGGE5utvTkU/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RaqfcUvt4QHa6v9AEXNs2s9YbON1xcnBhGGE5utvTkU/edit?usp=sharing)

6月月报:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AvTcV66yGhpuPn-U-Te0Ic-z5XjBQhcPt9Kp1qGNkXQ/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AvTcV66yGhpuPn-U-Te0Ic-z5XjBQhcPt9Kp1qGNkXQ/edit?usp=sharing)

7月月报:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-0raBj\_MQcNKmOZkgm439zenVvYzunZl3LCMb0DWwOA/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-0raBj_MQcNKmOZkgm439zenVvYzunZl3LCMb0DWwOA/edit?usp=sharing)

这一次提案的中文版本在这里： 

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PtXJ6y1MwgVF8PpBHceioYqDXX8CkBOhY11Na3CeSYw/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PtXJ6y1MwgVF8PpBHceioYqDXX8CkBOhY11Na3CeSYw/edit?usp=sharing)

我们的提案两周前就已经提交到讨论区进行讨论，目前得到的都是正面分反馈，希望能得到大家投票的支持，感谢大家。

Our endeavors also encompass both in-person and online events.

As of August 1st, our official Twitter ([https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao](https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao) has 1993 followers. Our Discord server ([https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk](https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk) has 535 members, our Telegram group ([https://t.me/aiweb3dao](https://t.me/aiweb3dao) has 328 members, and our decentralized Polkaverse space ([https://polkaverse.com/10900](https://polkaverse.com/10900) has 173 posts. Our presence extends to a WeChat Official Account and a video channel, "爱Web3", each video averaging over 1k views. We've also developed a Discord bot enriched with AI capabilities, and an intriguing role-upgrade game centered on a book about Polkadot, still in progress. In conclusion, the treasury's support over the past six months enabled us to offer Web3 education, nurture content creators, consolidate the community, devise a Discord bot now utilized by other parachain teams, establish pivotal partnerships in DotSama, revitalize Chinese communities, and achieve much more!

our monthly report contains more updates:

July report:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-0raBj\_MQcNKmOZkgm439zenVvYzunZl3LCMb0DWwOA/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-0raBj_MQcNKmOZkgm439zenVvYzunZl3LCMb0DWwOA/edit?usp=sharing)

The Full English version proposal can be found here： 

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/194jzl3FZN4T8kZuUTRdQSaitUGwRbNjSpU3ww6Z4p\_0/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/194jzl3FZN4T8kZuUTRdQSaitUGwRbNjSpU3ww6Z4p_0/edit?usp=sharing)

I would love to get feedback from the community so that I can come up with the best proposal, and I'd be happy to answer any questions and tweak the proposal as needed!

亲爱的DotSama社区，早上好/晚上好！

我是曹博士，Polkadot平行链项目Parallel Finance的社区经理，也是WagMedia中文社区的负责人，WagMedia委员会的委员，Centrifuge中文社区的负责人，以及Astar Network和Bifrost等多个Polkadot平行链项目的大使。此外，我还是Chaos DAO的成员。作为AIWeb3社区的创始人，我希望分享过去六个月AIWeb3社区的更新，并寻求社区和基金会对AIWeb3社区下一个半年的支持。

AIWeb3中文社区的使命是建设波卡社区，使中文内容创作者能够专注于DotSama的内容创作。我们的目标是连接不同的平行链项目，并确保社区能够获得最新信息。我们希望创建一种良好的环境使得中文内容创作者能欧集中精力进行内容创作和研究，生成高质量的内容，包括配音、翻译以及围绕DotSama的原创内容。此外，我们将分配更多资源来支持初创的内容创作者，帮助他们培养他们的观众和品牌。

AIWeb3中文社区欢迎对Polkadot生态系统、Web3及其长期前景充满激情的人。这包括与polkadot生态系统相关的内容创作者和polkadot爱好者。我们的社区建立在价值导向、长期投资策略、透明度、诚信和持续学习的基础之上。

在过去的半年中，在Kusama国库的支持下，AIWeb3的表现超出了我们自己的预期，由于我们优秀的创作者们和社区的支持，我们完成了所有计划的任务，甚至更多。我们制作了超过600个原创作品，完成了28次翻译和35次校对，以及4个高质量的配音。我们很高兴有19位内容创作者加入我们，其中13人至少做出了一次贡献。他们的专业知识囊括DeFi到NFT、艺术设计和组织活动等等。我们已经与超过20个平行链团队建立了关系，提出了16个合作倡议以获得额外的支持。我们与Neurolauncher、Astar生态系统中的社区驱动的NFT市场Bluez以及去中心化的平台Frentube ([https://twitter.com/fren\_tube)](https://twitter.com/fren_tube\)) 都建立了合作伙伴关系。我们也努力的开展线下和线上的活动。截至8月1日，我们的官方Twitter([https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao)](https://twitter.com/aiweb3dao\)) 拥有1993名关注者。我们的Discord服务器 ([https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk)](https://discord.gg/pQtZG8UQfk\)) 有535名成员，我们的Telegram群组([https://t.me/aiweb3dao)有328名成员， 我们的去中心化Polkaverse空间(https://polkaverse.com/10900)](https://t.me/aiweb3dao\)有328名成员，我们的去中心化Polkaverse空间\(https://polkaverse.com/10900\)) 有173篇帖子。我们还有一个微信官方账户和一个视频频道：“爱Web3”，每个视频的平均观看次数超过1k。我们还推出了一个带有AI功能的Discord机器人，以及一个关于Polkadot的有趣的角色升级游戏，目前仍在进行中。总之，感谢国库在过去6个月的资金支持，我们不仅提供了web3教育，支持内容创作者，而且还建立了社区，开发了Discord机器人并被其他平行链项目采用，与DotSama建立了重要的合作伙伴关系，振兴了波卡中国社区，未来还有更多！

items.title: POLKADOT SAFARI '23 (Request for second allocation of funds)
items.content:
Hello community,

This is a follow up request for the second allocation of funds from Polkadot Safari 2023 which took place in March and April. 

**Excuse the delay for updating this description, I was waiting for my signatories to approve my request for KSM for the decision deposit.**

Our previous request was erroneous (my mistake and I take full accountability). 

TL DR

When we converted the Kusama received, it was worth $234.127.97, at the time of receipt of the funds, KSM had dropped. Our original total ask between the first and second allocation was $289,313. Due to the depreciation of the Kenya Shilling to the dollar in February, March and April, the funds went a much longer way in covering the costs for the conference. Additionally, a few contributors worked a few hours and we substituted them with new contributors from February. Both of these factors rendered our new difference to decrease from $55,186 to $24,400.

I did not factor that in when I was submitting the referenda two weeks ago.

Please find our report and request for funds [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1cNkVSpiFSz1dbwlHUm_dg_F6rie0CpGE7TFXv5AQ1TI/edit). The $24,400 is what's left to pay off the organizer's. We had specifically ensured that we paid off all of the conference expenses before fully paying off ourselves.

Thank you for understanding, and may the sky be your basement.  
  
Sianoi

items.title: Kusama RPC services Dwellir Q3 2023
items.content:
This is a follow-up proposal to our [OpenGov treasury proposal](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/treasury/309) in Q2 2023.

### TLDR
Dwellir requests $18,765 for Q3 funding, covering the expenses of Q2 during which we served over 300 million RPC requests for the Kusama, Statemine, and Westmint communities. 

These services were seamlessly provided using our decentralized bare-metal infrastructure located in both Sweden and Tunisia, with all operational data transparently available at https://stats.dwellir.app/. 

Our commitment remains firm: offering top-tier, decentralized RPC services at an equitable price.
### The Proposal
This proposal is to further fund the development of the RPC services and to cover the maintenance costs of them.

This new proposal includes two Milestones: Operate fully managed public RPC endpoints (Kusama, Statemine and Westmint), and run a highly available boot node.  

**Summary of Key Statistics**

At Dwellir, we place a high value on transparency, understanding that it fosters trust and facilitates informed decision-making. To this end, we openly share our operational statistics with the community. This information is readily available at our dedicated portal, https://stats.dwellir.app/. 

Here, stakeholders can gain insight into our service to the various Kusama communities. We believe this transparency not only promotes accountability but also underscores our commitment to maintaining the highest standards of service delivery for the communities we serve.

- Our Kusama RPC nodes served on average **3,064,391** requests per day and in total **275,795,145** during the last quarter. 
- Our Statemine RPC nodes served on average **757,182** requests per day and in total **68,146,379** during the last quarter.
- Our Westmint RPC nodes served on average **102,939** requests per day and in total **9,264,542** during the last quarter.

Our full proposal can be [read here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iKqYGYYSHl3BBxnb-18Wnog-ML2qbZ9zERqEMrBaVhA/edit?usp=sharing).

For any questions or comments, please write in this thread.

/Team Dwellir

items.title: Maintenance for the substrate-api-client Aug-23 to Oct-23
items.content:
We'd like to fund maintenance of the [substrate-api-client](https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client) from August 2023 until October 2023.

The [substrate-api-client](https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client) is a Rust library for connecting to a substrate-based node via RPC in a no-std environment. An RPC client is a library, with similar features as [Polkadot-js](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/polkadotjs). With an RPC client developers can easily interact with any Polkadot or Kusama chain. There are [RPC clients](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/build-tools-index#rpc-and-api-tools) for different programming languages. For Rust, the most popular RPC client is [subxt](https://github.com/paritytech/subxt). Subxt uses the Rust standard library (std). The Rust standard library is not available in certain environments, such as trusted execution environments (like IntelSGX) or certain IoT devices. The substrate-api-client bridges this gap,  providing a library that can be used in such environments.

This proposal is a continuation of our previous maintenance proposals: [Nov22-Jan23](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/26), [Feb23-Apr23](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/88), [May23-Jul23](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/182). See also our reports in the comments section of each proposal. We aim to seek ongoing funding.

Details can be found in our [full proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VP5x4rQAgZr1q_KrHiAzGWfZGIsDOGq3vwWR-uUoWAQ/edit?usp=sharing)

items.title: [medium spender] Request for maintenance of Stakeworld's RPC infrastructure and bootnodes
items.content:
This request is for funding of:

* Maintaining public [RPC services](https://stakeworld.io/docs/rpc) for kusama, kusama commons (assethub, bridgehub), encointer, westend and westend assethub (all included in [polkadot.js.org](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss://ksm-rpc.stakeworld.io))
* Maintaining [bootnodes](https://stakeworld.io/docs/bootnode) for kusama and westend

In the previous 30 days we served:
* 133.390.042 Kusama & common chains RPC requests
* 37.080.656 Westend & common chains RPC requests

Live data can be seen on our [webpage](https://stakeworld.io/docs/rpc#live-stakeworld-rpc-data). 

It is a follow-up of our [previous opengov](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/189) and [earlier](https://github.com/stakeworld/stakeworld-treasury#readme) [ended](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/171) Infrastructure Maintenance Bounty requests. 

Previous request were more post funded (requested at the end or after a period) while this one is more pre funded (at the beginning of the period). Main reason for this is that there seems to be a sentiment against spendings of the treasuries in general (HACNA) and also some discussion about rpc node funding; how many providers do we need, are we going more to a light node enviroment without rpc servers? We would like to have some clarity of our funding in the light of planning our resources. For example [database sizes](https://stakeworld.io/docs/dbsize) of archive nodes are growing fast, we need to deploy extra servers in case the load of our servers gets too high, etc.  

We believe that:
* we provide a valuable service to the community with a reasonable funding
* at this moment rpc services are still needed because accessing the network by light nodes is not very functional/mainstream yet
* it is good to have diversity in providers and also smaller rpc providers should have a place in the ecosystem
* our track record is long enough to earn some trust that we will use pre-funding in a responsible way

Full proposal can be found [here](https://github.com/stakeworld/stakeworld-treasury/blob/master/2023-Q3-kusama.md), hoping for a positive outcome and of course open to discussion/comments. 

Regards, 
Max | Stakeworld.io

It is a follow-up of our [previous opengov](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/189) and [earlier](https://github.com/stakeworld/stakeworld-treasury#readme) [ended](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/171) Infrastructure Maintenance Bounty requests. 

Previous request were more post funded (requested at the end or after a period) while this one is more pre funded (at the beginning of the period). Main reason for this is that there seems to be a sentiment against spendings of the treasuries in general (HACNA) and also some discussion about rpc node funding; how many providers do we need, are we going more to a light node enviroment without rpc servers? We would like to have some clarity of our funding in the light of planning our resources. For example [database sizes](https://stakeworld.io/docs/dbsize) of archive nodes are growing fastly, we need to deploy extra servers in case the load of our servers gets too high, etc.  

We believe that:
* we provide a valuable service to the community with a reasonable funding
* at this moment rpc services are still needed because accessing the network by light nodes is not very functional/mainstream yet
* it is good to have diversity in providers and also smaller rpc providers should have a place in the ecosystem
* our track record is long enough to earn some trust that we will use pre-funding in a responsible way

Full proposal can be found [here](https://github.com/stakeworld/stakeworld-treasury/blob/master/2023-Q3-kusama.md)

Hoping for a positive outcome and of course open to discussion/comments. 

Regards, 
Max | Stakeworld.io

items.title: OnFinality High Performance Public Infrastructure (Q2 2023)
items.content:
**Proponent:** ELkVhHcvaP9L43RK9SP6Wn3FBfusEN5EJe2gH7aA2ETiufP

**Date:** 18th July 2023

**Requested:** KSM 2,534.3895 (USD $62,110.28)

**Short description:** Ongoing costs for the running of high performance, scalable, and reliable public infrastructure for Kusama and Statemine.

**Full Proposal:** [Kusama Q2 2023 Treasury Proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hHIh9fcqbhiDz0tqAFTaxm2-zU56XK_3CpM0r_CcvvU/edit?usp=sharing)

**Raw Data:** [Kusama Data Q2 2023](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mb5GI3KAz3mza0qehduwd332DtVoPNrpR2MIZHr2ZCc/edit?usp=sharing)

Original Motivation
===================

Over the last 3 months (April, May and June 2023) we've provided a scalable free public API service so that everyone can access public pools of managed Kusama and Statemine nodes. This provides the following three outcomes:

-   Grow the ecosystem by reducing the barriers to entry to access a high performance nodes

-   Help scale existing projects in the ecosystem by providing infrastructure  services that can be depended on

-   Assist with the testing of all networks by providing valuable data back to the community on how validator nodes are running and scaling as the network traffic increases (we've made Github issues based on behaviour we've observed)

Background on our RPC Service
=============================

Since inception in November 2020 we have made a large number of improvements to our Ultimate API service focussing on three key areas; performance/reliability, providing more value from our Ultimate API service, and cost optimisation.

### Performance/Reliability

OnFinality is operationally striving for a minimum of 99.99% reliability, which means less than an hour of downtime each year.  We proudly display and share our [90 day uptime statistics](https://status.onfinality.io/) for each network publicly [here](https://status.onfinality.io/uptime/r40wwpclbwzm).

We have invested hugely into a team dedicated to optimising our application gateway and caching layer to ensure that we provide the fastest possible service for our customers. We run clusters in 5 different regions (North Virginia, Frankfurt, Tokyo, Singapore, and Australia) and across 3 different cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Alicloud) to ensure that we are fault tolerant to any single region or cloud provider ceasing service.

### Providing more value from our Ultimate API service

For customers that do sign up for paid API keys, we've been adding more and more features to provide a better experience. [Geolocation insights](https://blog.onfinality.io/onfinality-adds-geolocation-insights-for-dapps-and-api-apps/) provide statistics about where in the world communities are to help influence decisions around where to expand infrastructure and to view the effectiveness of regional BD initiatives.  We can also now [automatically upsize the storage on nodes](https://blog.onfinality.io/onfinality-developer-update-auto-expand-storage-for-dedicated-nodes/) to prevent the risk of any downtime.

Finally, in Q2 of 2023 OnFinality [launched Trace API](https://blog.onfinality.io/onfinality-launches-trace-api-for-unprecedented-visibility-into-your-dapps/) support which was a huge enhancement allowing unprecedented visibility for dApp builders. Trace API captures and records vital information otherwise not available through regular RPC methods and extrinsics (such as complete XCM transfer records and complete list of balance changes). These APIs are essential in order for [developers like Polkaholic](https://blog.onfinality.io/onfinalitys-new-trace-api-helping-colorful-notion-get-trace-data-from-over-40-substrate-chains/) to parse and understand XCM transactions.

### Cost Optimisation

OnFinality is very conscious about providing a strong level of support for Polkadot/Kusama at an extremely competitive price. Cost saving measurement has been a significant focus on behalf of our customers, with advanced rate limiting controls implemented. We can, for example, rate limit each client on a burst and sustained basis and based on the request methods that they are calling (e.g. each state_traceBlock request is rate limited 45x more than chain_getBlock), [read more about these advanced rate limiting tools that we've developed here](https://documentation.onfinality.io/support/public-rate-limits).

Meaning that we can continue to provide generous public API endpoints for over 40 different networks for common-good applications, but restrict access to high volume users that abuse this free service. We've been able to manage our costs significantly on behalf of our customers as a result. 

We've [developed and shared our approach towards service sustainability](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/1270), with the introduction of a 'Paid API Revenue Share Discount' scheme. In this scheme OnFinality pools the revenue from customers that pay for higher API pricing plans and distributes this revenue pool to partners that currently pay for and own each API endpoint proportionally based on the number of paid API requests that go to that API endpoint. The scheme was introduced in Q1 of 2023 and resulted in a discount to [Kusama's Q1 treasury proposal](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/183) of $281.90.

Our cost optimisation efforts were validated in Q1 as we had the lowest cost per million responses across all of the major RPC providers that lodged a proposal to the Polkadot treasury. You can see how our costs compared to other RPC providers in the ecosystem during Q1 [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Utw2HfS7I5Gpyhrl9ejuj0CrQ4AcChGFteXdw0a8tro/edit#gid=0).

Service Details
===============

During Q2 of 2023, we've made a number of new improvements to our Ultimate API service that address performance/reliability, features, and costs.

Additionally, we are proud to have delivered some key service enhancements that benefit the Polkadot ecosystem in the last quarter. This includes:

-   [Launched Trace API](https://blog.onfinality.io/onfinality-launches-trace-api-for-unprecedented-visibility-into-your-dapps/) allowing unprecedented visibility for dApp builders. Trace API captures and records vital information otherwise not available through regular RPC methods and extrinsics (such as complete XCM transfer records and complete list of balance changes). These APIs are essential in order for [developers like Polkaholic](https://blog.onfinality.io/onfinalitys-new-trace-api-helping-colorful-notion-get-trace-data-from-over-40-substrate-chains/) to parse and understand XCM transactions.

-   [Geographical Insights](https://blog.onfinality.io/onfinality-adds-geolocation-insights-for-dapps-and-api-apps/) - API key owners can view statistics about where in the world your community are to help influence decisions around where to expand infrastructure and to view the effectiveness of regional BD initiatives

-   [Clarify our IP address handling](https://blog.onfinality.io/how-does-onfinality-deal-with-personal-information/) - OnFinality does not, and will never, correlate or link specific wallet addresses to the IP address or request origin making the RPC request

-   Added support for a number of new networks, including Anmol, HydraDX, Equilibrium, as well as Osmosis, Evmos, Harmony, Arbitrum, Optimism, Fuse, DFK Chain, Celo, and Klaytn from outside the ecosystem. OnFinality is a new one stop shop for all of your RPC needs from multiple ecosystems.

-   A variety of improvements to our health metric collection tools and automated recovery scripts to ensure our 99.9% SLA is exceeded.

-   Scale improvements to our team, processes, and systems to allow us to provide this same service to any  substrate team

Our customers are building cross-chain wallets, running some of the largest block explorers, and are indexing multiple networks - they've all benefited from these API access restrictions, improved monitoring, and the larger number of supported Polkadot chains. You can always see live data on our API service on our public [status page](https://status.onfinality.io/).

Between 2023-04-01 and 2023-06-30 our Kusama API service has:

-   Served almost 2  billion (1,962,258,944) responses

-   Accumulated over 31,000 GB of data egress

-   The highest daily total was over 42 million responses in a single 24 hour period for Kusama alone

-   Our rolling 7 day average at the end of this period was over 10 million responses each day

-   Statemine had over 130  million (132,310,628) API responses in the period

-   All time totals for Kusama is 42,881,996,808 (over 42 billion) since November, 2020

-   At the end of this period the 90 day uptime on Kusama and Statemine was 99.93% and 100% respectively

Costings
========

This proposal includes combined running costs for our infrastructure for Kusama and Statemine. The total combined running cost is USD $62,110.28 - [raw data is here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mb5GI3KAz3mza0qehduwd332DtVoPNrpR2MIZHr2ZCc/edit?usp=sharing).

**For breakdown of costings and more information, read the full proposal here:** [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hHIh9fcqbhiDz0tqAFTaxm2-zU56XK_3CpM0r_CcvvU/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hHIh9fcqbhiDz0tqAFTaxm2-zU56XK_3CpM0r_CcvvU/edit?usp=sharing)

Lovisa

items.content:
Hello Everyone! This one is the correct one as the decision deposit could be placed. 

Now the referendum is up and running re: the Gavin Wood documentary previously discussed here: https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/2588

The request for the treasury is 600 KSM. It is referenda nr. 239 - not 240. 

The full project proposal is attached below. Gavin will give his consent in the comments.

I will be available for any questions and suggestions throughout filming and editing.

Happy voting!

Lovisa

Project proposal :

https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vQXsCTC6-GV6mDCQ6svEFOOwzzrfMYNRwjOKfcxuWQH_na_D6qd6TTghpLwW6x-EQ/pub

history.content: Apologies, something got wonky with this submission. The current one is: https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/240

Hello Everyone! Opening the vote for approving funding for the Gavin Wood documentary previously discussed here: https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/2588 (Also pasted below) The full project proposal is attached below. Gavin will give his consent in the comments. I will be available for any questions and suggestions throughout filming and editing. Happy voting! Lovisa Hello Kusama Community, My name is Lovisa Björna, and I have the last months been filming and recording a lot of material from Gavin’s day-to-day life, which I have been closely intertwined with for the last three years. I started recording some of the conversations we were having a while back, tapping “record” whenever something particularly interesting came up. Partly for me to remember later on, and to eventually be able to turn this material into something educational for the general public. I believe the moment has now arrived, and I am looking for a modest amount of funding from the Kusama treasury to purchase better recording equipment and, down the line, be able to hire a professional film editor to present the material properly. I’m also looking to onboard 2-3 people with experience in directing, sound design and art direction to pitch the film to film festivals and other media outlets. I am seeking 550 KSM / 13,271 USD to cover full production costs. The goal is to present a documentary film portrait of Gavin next spring. Due to the nature of the material, the project will not be focused primarily on explaining the details of the ecosystems, i.e. I won’t add any infographics as other people and projects can do that better. As it looks now, it is intimate “behind the scenes” material that shows him simply living, thinking and working. The conversations/interviews mainly treat themes of technology, specifically the introduction of new technology and how it works, philosophical enquiries around personal and collective freedom, state building and infrastructure, the responsibility of technologists and builders, and societal commentary and personal values. I will link a preview in the comments section. Before posting the complete application to the Kusama Treasury, I am interested in hearing if there are any specific themes/settings the community would be especially interested in exploring. Any questions, in particular, you would like answered? Any critiques or other comments? Lovisa
history.title: Treasury Proposal : Funding for Gavin Wood documentary / portrait

Gavin will give his consent in the comments. I will be available for any questions and suggestions throughout filming and editing. Happy voting! Lovisa Hello Kusama Community, My name is Lovisa Björna, and I have the last months been filming and recording a lot of material from Gavin’s day-to-day life, which I have been closely intertwined with for the last three years. I started recording some of the conversations we were having a while back, tapping “record” whenever something particularly interesting came up. Partly for me to remember later on, and to eventually be able to turn this material into something educational for the general public. I believe the moment has now arrived, and I am looking for a modest amount of funding from the Kusama treasury to purchase better recording equipment and, down the line, be able to hire a professional film editor to present the material properly. I’m also looking to onboard 2-3 people with experience in directing, sound design and art direction to pitch the film to film festivals and other media outlets. I am seeking 550 KSM / 13,271 USD to cover full production costs. The goal is to present a documentary film portrait of Gavin next spring. Due to the nature of the material, the project will not be focused primarily on explaining the details of the ecosystems, i.e. I won’t add any infographics as other people and projects can do that better. As it looks now, it is intimate “behind the scenes” material that shows him simply living, thinking and working. The conversations/interviews mainly treat themes of technology, specifically the introduction of new technology and how it works, philosophical enquiries around personal and collective freedom, state building and infrastructure, the responsibility of technologists and builders, and societal commentary and personal values. I will link a preview in the comments section. Before posting the complete application to the Kusama Treasury, I am interested in hearing if there are any specific themes/settings the community would be especially interested in exploring. Any questions, in particular, you would like answered? Any critiques or other comments? Lovisa
history.title: Treasury Proposal : Funding for Gavin Wood documentary / portrait

items.title: RadiumBlock seeks reimbursement for Kusama Endpoint Service (Q2 2023)
items.content:
The RadiumBlock team, an infrastructure provider for the Polkadot/Substrate community, is seeking reimbursement for the provision of RPC services for the Kusama networks for Q2 2023. We operate one the highest performance RPC service in polkadot ecosystem (https://www.comparenodes.com/global-node-comparison/407c5245-0c6f-4abe-be49-1ff0b25a2938/)

RadiumBlock requests reimbursement for 

- Kusama RPC endpoint 
- AssetHub/Statemine RPC endpoint 


RadiumBlock’s RPC include:

- Archive node based RPC endpoints
- Support both websocket and http for RPC requests
- 12 location PoP
- Use our on-prem high availability hardware at collocated data centers
- Better cost and decentralization
- Low latency access across the world


We are seeking 
- $22,050 for Q2 2023

### Service Usage Summary
For Q2 2023 (April-June)

- Our Kusama RPC nodes have served an average of 38 million responses per day
- Our Statemine RPC nodes have served an average of 1.5 million responses per day

We continue engagement in the ecosystem as an infrastructure provider for other para chains such as Astar, Ajuna with others planned. 

Our [full proposal is posted here.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NhQD-u0TemUQKvx-xn5QeIFrSVdBUj-H/edit)

items.title: Subscan | Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Kusama & Statemine (from July to December 2022)
items.content:
> This is a follow up proposal to what we submitted before: 
> - [Subscan | Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Polkadot & Kusama & Westend & Rococo Networks（until June 30, 2022）](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wXSELzfmNH1CP9JbI5Nq1wu8H83vnxJJ22TEjkF2Wgg/edit#heading=h.mja6oa2ekup8)
> - [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/child_bounty/56](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/child_bounty/56)


Subscan is an essential block explorer and analytics tool for the Kusama & Statemine network, providing valuable insights to the Substrate community. However, the maintenance and operation of Subscan requires a significant investment of resources, including server infrastructure, security, and personnel costs. Therefore, we propose reimbursing the operation and maintenance fee for Subscan from July to December 2022 from the Kusama treasury to ensure its continuous operation and maintenance.


We believe that this reimbursement proposal will help to ensure the continuous operation and maintenance of Subscan, and benefit the growth and development of the Kusama network. This time, we plan to apply for a total of 60,185 USD in Kusama, the amount of KSM will be converted based on the EMA7 price on the day of the official submission.


Billing details can be read [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/14jxQGNpviEkQBA8owGX1j2AyCUeNJ_t9QN-p-7he36E/edit?usp=sharing).
We sincerely hope to receive your support or feedback.

items.title: Treasury Proposal: Kusama decentralization analytics, 9 months Continued operation (50% already delivered)
items.content:
Dear Community!

[Polkawatch](https://kusama.polkawatch.app/) provides decentralization analytics for Kusama.

We recently delivered improved observability for Polkawatch based on Node-Red, improved its plugin, and shared it all with our community in a [blog post](https://blog.polkawatch.app/polkawatch-observability/) in case anyone finds it useful.

We also added Parachain Support, including those based on Aura consensus, and included decentralization analytics for [Statemine](https://statemine.polkawatch.app/), sharing it in another [blog post](https://blog.polkawatch.app/parachain-support-statemine/).

Along the process we found [2 issues](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/issues/6696) in Polkadot/substrate, and collaborated with the developer teams during the resolution.

We also implemented community feedback, adding Scaleway as redundant IPFS endpoint, instead of using only Hetzner.

We are now seeking for 9 months Continued operation for Polkawatch.

The proposal has been created in a context in which our Treasure is constrained. As such we have deferred new developments and claim operational costs only after 50% has been delivered, in an attempt to contribute to improve the cash-flow position of our Treasury.

You can find all the details in our [detailed proposal](https://pwh.li/ksm23q13pf), and do not hesitate to provide additional feedback.

items.title: Treasury proposal: RMRKv2 Integration in KodaDot - Kusama's NFT Infrastructure
items.content:
# Hello Kusama & Polkadot community

## Link to discussion created by Damsky 
- [https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/2575](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/2575)

## Who are we?
[KodaDot](https://twitter.com/KodaDot) is an inclusive, open-source NFT marketplace on the Kusama network that fosters collaboration and sustainability. With support from its core team and over 100 contributors, KodaDot prioritizes creators, developers, and community members from diverse backgrounds. The platform emphasizes environmentally responsible practices, collaborating with [Offsetra](https://offsetra.com/profile/kodadot) and [RMTerra](https://blog.kodadot.xyz/you-dont-need-to-go-far-to-help-the-nature-just-mint-on-kodadot-496fc60cd748) for emissions compensation and global reforestation efforts. KodaDot's success and commitment to quality have earned it the top position in GitHub's "polkadot" topics, demonstrating its strong presence in the decentralized application landscape ranking as [#1 dApp in Polkadot](https://github.com/topics/polkadot).

## Overview of proposal
This proposal focuses on integrating RMRKv2 into KodaDot, a community-driven and inclusive NFT marketplace on the Kusama network, in response to RMRK’s shift towards Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) support. The goal is to provide Kusama users with continued access to a sustainable and accessible platform for NFT trading using the latest RMRKv2 standard.

## Funding requested:
$100,000, divided into two installments ($72k for Milestones 0-3, $28k for Milestones 4-7)

## Full proposal link:
[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1q1EJ7OAUwKzC4wjjMATOJxZWLKo9kxS8137Or_Y4rME](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1q1EJ7OAUwKzC4wjjMATOJxZWLKo9kxS8137Or_Y4rME)

## Requested amount:
- $72,000 for milestones 0-3 (Completed)
- $28,000 for milestones 4-7 (Ongoing & Upcoming)

## Context of the proposal:
By integrating RMRKv2 into KodaDot, this proposal aims to fill the gap left by RMRK's focus on EVM and maintain a sustainable, inclusive platform for NFT trading within the Kusama network. The goal is to strengthen the Kusama NFT ecosystem through the integration of RMRKv2 and foster community engagement, innovation, and cross-chain collaboration. The implementation process, milestones, partnerships, and success criteria are detailed in the proposal context.

## Objectives
- Integrate RMRKv2 into KodaDot to provide Kusama users with a sustainable and inclusive platform for NFT trading and engagement.
- Strengthen the Kusama NFT ecosystem through collaboration, innovation, and cross-chain integration.
- Ensure continued success and growth of Kusama's NFT ecosystem, catering to creators, collectors, and traders using the latest RMRKv2 standard.

## What happens if the implemenation doesn’t happen?

If the implementation does not happen, the Kusama community and NFT creators, collectors, and traders would miss out on the following benefits:
- Seamless access to a thriving NFT marketplace that supports the RMRKv2 standard.
- A dynamic ecosystem for artists, developers, and collectors, enabling more robust and versatile NFT creations.
- Encouraging further innovation and development within the Kusama network, allowing for the expansion of projects and use-cases.
- Enhanced user experience and greater trading opportunities within the NFT ecosystem as a result of a community-driven development process.
- Improved opportunities for cross-chain integration, partnerships, and collaborations within the broader Kusama and Polkadot ecosystems.
- NFTs, as long-term assets with potential for value appreciation, require a focus on growth and maintaining value. KodaDot's RMRKv2 integration offers unique content on the Kusama network, promoting NFT sustainability and value in the evolving digital space. With a robust custom implementation, KodaDot provides reliable data longevity for NFT transactions and serves as a dependable NFT explorer. Furthermore, KodaDot's efficient and optimized platform outperforms competitors, as its bundle is 270 times smaller, ensuring resilience in the NFT trading process.

items.title: Visualize polkadot program phase1 bounty top up
items.content:
Please check [subsquare](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/referendum/215) for full details.

- Date: 08.06.2023
- Proponent: OpenSquare(ESgz7GLVW7BL5DhRgpVnxSXVwaKt4ytWcrf52TY1GQD1cEb)
- Bounty address: F3opxRbN5ZbjJNU513biNd7gHacZD1K3wU4M6Yiq3MZxZgf
- KSM requested: 3,100 KSM

---

Please check [Bounty #11](https://kusama.subsquare.io/treasury/bounty/11) or [full proposal](https://hackmd.io/@WIq3uV0rRwS6W3GGj2pmyA/Sy9-nCF9t) for details of polkadot visualization bounty program. Its targets includes:
- Implement a group of UI to show business of kusama/polkadot.
- Engage more developers to dotsama developing in the way of child bounties.
- Seek ways to facilitate collaborations between projects and external developers in the dotsama ecosystem.

Current achivements:
- Developed and released a site for collaborations in a bounty and child bounty way. Bounty curators can import bounties or child bounties on chain to this site, and external developers can apply them. This bounty site support basic collaboration flows between curators and external developers. Funded by [child bounty #34](https://kusama.subsquare.io/treasury/child-bounty/11_34).
- [Statescan-v2](https://github.com/opensquare-network/statescan-v2) is developed and released. Now it support polkadot, kusama and several other common good para chains. It's 100% open source. Compared to statescan v1, v2 is more modularized and friendly for collaboration between developers. V2 development work is still not paid due to the market condition.
- [Bounty #245](https://bounties.opensquare.io/#/network/kusama/bounty/11/child-bounty/245) and [bounty #335](https://bounties.opensquare.io/#/network/kusama/bounty/11/child-bounty/335) are created for identity and vesting pallet business scan. Identity scan child bounty has been awarded, while vesting pallet child bounty is still under developing. 2 external developers are enrolled.


Please check [subsquare](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/referendum/215) for more details.

items.title: (Polkadot Latam, Start)
items.content:
### Polkadot Latam  Development Center in Honduras

Proponent: Polkadot Latam: CpNGK3pS1uHPcPAzEzH9Ede8JZWrDFb8RpdUEoQ4SiBabuT
### Request: 1033.389 KSM
 
 KSM (USD $31,005.81 USD) (Rate: $30.004/KSM based on EMA 30 ~ Subscan 16:34 GMT -6 **(11/5 2023)**
 
**Greetings**

We are **Polkadot Latam**, an organization committed to promoting the **Polkadot** and **Kusama** blockchain ecosystem in **Honduras** to later expand in **Latin America**. We would like to submit a proposal for the creation of a Polkadot development community in the region.
The lack of information and education around blockchain in the Latin community represents a barrier to its adoption and growth in the region. Therefore, we will focus on creating a specific community in Honduras and promote the adoption of the technology throughout the country.
Our goal is to create a **robust** and **accessible** community centered on three fundamental pillars: **governance, development** and **community**.

To achieve this, we will start by organizing events in the **Honduras capital Tegucigalpa**,  in **educational centers, media, universities** and other interested parties who can experience the **Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems,** share **knowledge** and discover new opportunities for collaboration.
In this initial stage, we will work on **creating high quality educational content** in ****Spanish**** so that Spanish speakers can better understand Polkadot and Kusama's blockchain technology, and can leverage it in their daily lives and foster the adoption of Polkadot in the region and in **the long term grow the Polkadot ecosystem**. 

To support this initiative, we are requesting funding of **1033.389 KSM, 31005.81 USD** for the creation of the **Polkadot community in Honduras**, the organization of events and the creation of educational content. We believe this investment will be a profitable and strategic opportunity for the growth and expansion of blockchain technology in the region.
Changes and **updates** to the **artwork** will be carried out, implementing new vectorized and modeled objects. For example: **3D modeling** of the various current **vectors** representing the network environment. With the ultimate goal of creating the most efficient learning method for Polkadot and Kusama.

Unity is Strength! Therefore, this method requires the recurrent approval of the community, as well as the contribution of feedbacks that reflect **new ideas** and **recommendations**, so that the final audiovisual material is ideal for those who visualize and study it, we will create a library with all the resources, which have been built and so that other people can generate quality content. 

**Below is an example of the type of content to create.**

[Polkadot and Kusama's definitive guide: What are parachains?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tEUWmdxyge0&t=41s)


We hope that our proposal will be considered and approved, and we are confident that the creation of a Polkadot community in Honduras will have a significant impact on the adoption of blockchain technology in the region.

[our mission and long-term vision](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8nFBBNlxJI4&t=4s)

You can access our detailed proposal via the [link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yTye35v3NFzYVBDYCaGXPgtY-WBd0eYTpK4yV_vGSK4/edit) provided.


Thank you for your time and consideration.

**Sincerely yours.**
**Polkadot Latam.**

The lack of information and education around blockchain in the Latin community represents a barrier to its adoption and growth in the region. Therefore, we will focus on creating a specific community in Honduras and promote the adoption of the technology throughout the country.
Our goal is to create a **robust** and **accessible** community centered on three fundamental pillars: **governance, development** and **community**.

To achieve this, we will start by organizing events in the **Honduras capital Tegucigalpa**,  in **educational centers, media, universities** and other interested parties who can experience the **Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems,** share **knowledge** and discover new opportunities for collaboration.
In this initial stage, we will work on **creating high quality educational content** in ****Spanish**** so that Spanish speakers can better understand Polkadot and Kusama's blockchain technology, and can leverage it in their daily lives and foster the adoption of Polkadot in the region and in **the long term grow the Polkadot ecosystem**. 

To support this initiative, we are requesting funding of **1033.389 KSM, 31005.81 USD** for the creation of the **Polkadot community in Honduras**, the organization of events and the creation of educational content. We believe this investment will be a profitable and strategic opportunity for the growth and expansion of blockchain technology in the region.
Changes and **updates** to the **artwork** will be carried out, implementing new vectorized and modeled objects. For example: **3D modeling** of the various current **vectors** representing the network environment. With the ultimate goal of creating the most efficient learning method for Polkadot and Kusama.

Unity is Strength! Therefore, this method requires the recurrent approval of the community, as well as the contribution of feedbacks that reflect **new ideas** and **recommendations**, so that the final audiovisual material is ideal for those who visualize and study it, we will create a library with all the resources, which have been built and so that other people can generate quality content. 

**Below is an example of the type of content to create.**

[Polkadot and Kusama's definitive guide: What are parachains?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tEUWmdxyge0&t=41s)


We hope that our proposal will be considered and approved, and we are confident that the creation of a Polkadot community in Honduras will have a significant impact on the adoption of blockchain technology in the region.

[our mission and long-term vision](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8nFBBNlxJI4&t=4s)

You can access our detailed proposal via the [link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yTye35v3NFzYVBDYCaGXPgtY-WBd0eYTpK4yV_vGSK4/edit) provided.


Thank you for your time and consideration.

**Sincerely yours.**
**Polkadot Latam.**

history.title: Untitled

items.title: ParaSpell XCM SDK Maintenance funding for 5months
items.content:
Dear Kusama community,

**On behalf of our team** , we propose the maintenance bounty of a common good tool enhancing experience on the Polkadot ecosystem - ParaSpell XCM SDK & XCM UI that will work to aid team that have been previously funded by Web3 Foundation ([phase1](https://github.com/w3f/Grants-Program/pull/1118),[phase2](https://github.com/w3f/Grants-Program/pull/1245),[phase3](https://github.com/w3f/Grants-Program/pull/1589)) which also proposed the idea of Treasury maintenance funding for this project here: [link](https://github.com/w3f/Grants-Program/pull/1541#issuecomment-1441342524)

More information on previous project funding and achievements can be found in our official docs: [link](https://paraspell.github.io/docs/#project-achievements-so-far)

**We created XCM SDK that connects all 46 currently compatible Parachains together into a tiny package that is very simple to implement and saves a ton of time for developers looking to integrate XCM support into their dApp.** As new Parachains keep integrating XCM support we need to keep XCM SDK maintained to satisfy the growing needs of developers that are integrating this package into their dApps.

This maintenance proposal is for maintaining repositories and performing continued operations to improve XCM SDK & XCM UI in many useful ways mentioned in our application document below.

We believe that this tool is needed in the Polkadot ecosystem and we are working very hard to prove this. Unification of XCM pallets which are currently very diverse can bring ease of integration and speed up dApp development significantly. This Polkadot forum post goes to show, that developers actively search for such tools. [link](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/grant-ideas-and-wishlists/399)

**Links that might interest you:**

Link to the pre-proposal discussion held between 20.May-27.May: [Polkassembly](../post/2577), [Subsquare](https://kusama.subsquare.io/post/9)

XCM SDK - [link](https://github.com/paraspell/xcm-sdk)

An organization with all repositories - [link](https://github.com/paraspell)

Our current metrics can be seen here - [link](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55763425/239685371-84a5214e-ccc6-41c8-b551-7ff655304501.png) , our SDK is also implemented by the biggest Polkadot NFT marketplace called KodaDot.

**Further information** on the maintenance mechanism, management of the funds and budget can be found in the [maintenance proposal document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FIHTKMcsWC6VGg1I-dz--5JLAk0GbKv8ZpZciek-awA/edit?usp=sharing).
history.title: Treasury proposal: ParaSpell XCM SDK Maintenance funding for 5months

items.title: Privacy Sidechains for all Substrate- Based Chains
items.content:
This treasury proposal aims to retro-actively cover the first 28 person days of completed work on implementing privacy sidechains for any substrate based chain. This benefits Polkadot and Kusama relaychains but also all their parachains and even solochains - without the need to change a single thing in their runtimes!

[Detailed Proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pudS6BEg3asqb9qK8bYqroMn8tzKs55Psf7C8nLtvwI/edit#heading=h.v5aqb6kex6j9) and [Discussion Thread](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/1739)

[Blog post about why privacy matters and our longer term vision](https://medium.com/integritee/a-privacy-sidechain-for-all-polkadot-kusama-chains-1bb52dc9b0d7)

[brenzi's presentation at Polkadot Now India 2023 [video, 12min]](https://youtu.be/7he0Uqe9jps)

items.title: Ziggurat - Kusama Treasury Proposal - Milestone 1
items.content:
This is a proposal relating to the previous discussion [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/2570). As requested in the previous discussion we:
- Clarified some budget items and staffing assignments
- Created a more non-technical oriented TL:DR and description
- Reached out to the Kusama and Polkadot developer communities and asked for their feedback
- Received a positive response from aforementioned communities (as evidenced in the discussion above)

TL:DR:

1.  Network level attacks are an unresearched area of risk for blockchains
2. Ziggurat helps detect network level attacks before they happen.
3. We propose to build out Ziggurat to support substrate based networks, starting with Kusama.

## Short Description

A Ziggurat is a rectangular stepped tower that uses precise measurements to ensure that each foundation can support the layers above.

This metaphor can be applied to network testing by defining three layers:

- Conformance: adherence to the network protocol
- Performance: healthy throughput under pressure
- Resistance: the withstanding of malicious behavior

Ziggurat by Equilibrium, is a set of tools that allows node developers to test these three layers extensively and ensure that each new release does not introduce bugs, performance bottlenecks, or security flaws.

As mentioned in the conclusion of the recent [Trail of Bits report](https://assets-global.website-files.com/5fd11235b3950c2c1a3b6df4/62af6c641a672b3329b9a480_Unintended_Centralities_in_Distributed_Ledgers.pdf): It’s only a matter of time before a blockchain network is completely toppled by a network-level hack. This proposal will detail why this work is critical, and how we will go about solving it.

Ziggurat currently supports a multitude of other blockchains, but does **not yet** have support for any Substrate-based chains such as Kusama.

This proposal is for the **first milestone** of this process: Creating a test plan. Please see **Milestone 1's** description in the overall proposal [**here**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HRhFKo5w73wP5Nz8hg3xtw5GmPseNrzsarJLNNZqDZo/edit#heading=h.3xl84ufmazmq).
 
## The Team behind it

Lukasz Jedrzejczyk ([GitHub](https://github.com/ljedrz), [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ljedrz)) has followed the development of Rust since before it became stable in 2015 and has been a proactive contributor to the Rust compiler and its StackOverflow community. He has participated in the development of multiple peer-to-peer nodes belonging to blockchains and other distributed systems, usually concentrating on the network layer. Notable examples are Rust IPFS and Aleo.

Niklas Long ([GitHub](https://github.com/niklaslong), [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/niklaslong)) deeply cares about open source, distributed systems and data privacy. He has been on the Aleo Core Team since late 2020, mostly overhauling, testing and profiling their network; is the author of Ziggurat and an active contributor to Rust IPFS.

Karlo Mardešić ([GitHub](https://github.com/Rqnsom)) is an embedded software engineer with a solid background in time network synchronization. An eager and passionate learner, he joined Eiger searching for exciting problems in the blockchain world and is currently focused on testing the network protocols. He takes great pleasure working in Rust and OSS community.

Mark Henderson ([GitHub](https://github.com/aphelionz), [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aphelionz)) is the VP of Engineering at Equilibrium. He has led the team starting with the original Rust IPFS grant in late 2019, through engagements with many of the largest names in Web3, and is now circling back to finish the critical work the team started with the original Ziggurat proposal. Core contributor to OrbitDB, Rust IPFS, and Ziggurat.

## Proposal Team Experience

[Equilibrium](https://equilibrium.co/) is a software consultancy and venture studio with a mission to further privacy and decentralization. Our clients include StarkWare, ZCash, Aleo, Protocol Labs, The Ethereum Foundation, The XRPL Foundation, Polygon and quite a few more. Our expertise is deeply technical, and we also employ economists and expert cryptographers to deliver results beyond the bounds of software development.

Much of our recent work has involved the design and testing of peer-to-peer networks in both familiar (e.g. libp2p) and customized contexts. Our impact typically falls into the following categories:

**Bug Fixing**

- detecting vulnerabilities using dedicated fuzz tests
- squashing memory leaks
- detecting and fixing blocking operations in asynchronous contexts

**Implementation**

- creating alternative implementations of network protocols
- creating thorough network integration tests
- simplifying existing implementations, suggesting protocol improvements

**Profiling**

- creating integration-level benchmarks
- detecting and investigating memory/CPU spikes
- introducing/increasing parallelism where applicable

**Network Analysis**

- crawling swarms using the P2P network layer (not RPC)
- visualizing data to display on a web-based interface
- gathering metrics such as reachable node cardinality, as well as node and network protocol versions

Furthermore, Equilibrium has a taste for graphic and product design, seen in the execution of Vanilla, the [XRPL Hooks Playground](https://hooks.xrpl.org/), and the in-progress [Ziggurat GUI](https://app.runziggurat.com/zcashd) site itself.

For a detailed budget and breakdown of price, see the [attached proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HRhFKo5w73wP5Nz8hg3xtw5GmPseNrzsarJLNNZqDZo/edit?usp=sharing).

Unfurled:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HRhFKo5w73wP5Nz8hg3xtw5GmPseNrzsarJLNNZqDZo/edit?usp=sharing

items.title: Funding for KryptosChain Media Brand - 6 months
items.content:
Hello Polkadot & Kusama community!

My name's Claudio, **Polkadot Ambassador** and I also run the **KryptosChain** media brand ([Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/kryptoschain) & [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KryptosChain)), you likely have heard of me before, either because you watched my videos or because you have seen me actively contributing in governance in the last number of months., but if you don't. I'm an ex-Database Developer who developed a passion for content creation in Web3 and have started a Youtube channel in April of 2018 with the scope to share my research with other crypto enthusiasts as well as use my tech knowledge to do tutorials and try and explain users something techier in a non tech way.

As Polkadot launched in 2020, I started doing media coverage about the ecosystem and have since been doing mostly that.

I had previously raised a proposal (not for my main KryptosChain channel) in **January 2023** which had passed public voting and which is [#Ref.46](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/46) and  has since been delivered. 
You can find the final delivery report [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/12kPiNeT9Zpc5xn3HXWgsaeM7YGRJV5dEL-97Uohf3_4). This was an initiative to grow a Romanian community who didn't have any content available about Polkadot. 

While delivering the proposal for #Ref.46 I had continued to produce content on my main channel, KryptosChain including interviews with Founders from the Polkadot ecosystem without requesting additional funding from the Treasury and had been managed within that budget as the KSM price had performed very well between referendum start date and receiving the funds and I felt it was only normal to do that for the community.

This new proposal is to request treasury funding for a new initiative which I believe and hope will bring a new group of users to the Polkadot ecosystem.

To produce a total of **116 videos** over a period of **6 months** of the following types:

- Comparison videos between different ecosystems, Cosmos, Cardano, Solana, Aptos, Sui & Avalanche **x 52 videos** 
(Compare products such as DEFI dApps, wallets and NFT marketplaces from the above ecosystems to those on Polkadot and talk about the pros & cons)

- General Polkadot ecosystem news **x 26 videos**

- Open Governance news regarding treasury spends  **x 26 videos**
(Kusama but will include Polkadot when / if it launches during this proposal period)  

- Interviews with Founders / Co-Founders or other team members **x 12 videos**

You can find the **full proposal** [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JjhrPR0z50IZSXiI423HbAhsx_4GyiSNRQS3_6ohWcA)

The discussion can be found by clicking the link at the top of this page which has been linked to this referendum.

The requested amount is **1,651.17 KSM** , worth approximately **$41,395 @ $25.07** per **KSM** at today's market price.
Should the price of KSM appreciate within the 14 days + the additional days before the payment from the treasury is sent, I will be transferring the extra KSM back to the Treasury. Should the price drop, I will work with what I got and should it drop by a lot, I will be requesting an additional top-up to make up for it in a separate proposal (Let's hope it won't be needed).

I look forward to your feedback over these next 14 days of the referendum.

Regards,

Claudio

As Polkadot launched in 2020, I started doing media coverage about the ecosystem and have since been doing mostly that.

I had previously raised a proposal (not for my main KryptosChain channel) in **January 2023** which had passed public voting and which is [#Ref.46](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/46) and  has since been delivered. 
You can find the final delivery report [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/12kPiNeT9Zpc5xn3HXWgsaeM7YGRJV5dEL-97Uohf3_4). This was an initiative to grow a Romanian community who didn't have any content available about Polkadot. 

While delivering the proposal for #Ref.46 I had continued to produce content on my main channel, KryptosChain including interviews with Founders from the Polkadot ecosystem without requesting additional funding from the Treasury and had been managed within that budget as the KSM price had performed very well between referendum start date and receiving the funds and I felt it was only normal to do that for the community.

This new proposal is to request treasury funding for a new initiative which I believe and hope will bring a new group of users to the Polkadot ecosystem.

To produce a total of **116 videos** over a period of **6 months** of the following types:

- Comparison videos between different ecosystems, Cosmos, Cardano, Solana, Aptos, Sui & Avalanche **x 52 videos** 
(Compare products such as DEFI dApps, wallets and NFT marketplaces from the above ecosystems to those on Polkadot and talk about the pros & cons)

- General Polkadot ecosystem news **x 26 videos**

- Open Governance news regarding treasury spends  **x 26 videos**
(Kusama but will include Polkadot when / if it launches during this proposal period)  

- Interviews with Founders / Co-Founders or other team members **x 12 videos**

You can find the **full proposal** [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JjhrPR0z50IZSXiI423HbAhsx_4GyiSNRQS3_6ohWcA)

The requested amount is **1,592.72 KSM** , worth approximately **$41,395 @ $25.99** per **KSM** at today's market price.
This will be adapted when the referendum will be created on-chain to the current market rate and should the price of KSM appreciate within the 14 days + the additional days before the payment from the treasury is sent, I will be transferring the extra KSM back to the Treasury. Should the price drop, I will work with what I got and should it drop by a lot, I will be requesting an additional top-up to make up for it in a separate proposal (Let's hope it won't be needed).

I look forward to your feedback over these next 7 days & thanks in advance for taking the time to read the proposal & leave any feedback.

Regards,

Claudio

items.title: Polkassembly Maintenance proposal Q2’23
items.content:
Polkassembly is an integral part of polkadot and kusama governance. This submission proposes a recurring payment (quarterly) to cover maintenance, operations and human resource costs for Polkassembly, including general maintenance, runtime upgrades changes and could/infrastructure cost. This submission covers costs for April, May, June of 2023. The maintenance proposal alternates between Polkadot & Kusama treasury and we are requesting the Kusama treasury to provide funds this time.

This recurring proposal aims to secure the continuous operation and sustainability of Polkassembly, a vital component of Polkadot and Kusama governance.

To ensure the smooth functioning of Polkassembly, we request a recurring quarterly payment to cover essential expenses such as maintenance, operations, and human resources. The funds are allocated towards general maintenance, runtime upgrades, and infrastructure costs, guaranteeing the reliability and efficiency of Polkassembly.

Specifically, this submission addresses the funding requirements for the months of April, May, and June in 2023. As part of the alternating maintenance proposal between the Polkadot and Kusama treasuries, we kindly request the Kusama treasury to provide the necessary funding for this period.

Attached below are key highlights of our proposal: 

- **Customization**: Implementing a customizable and dynamic notification engine across multiple platforms (mail, telegram, slack, discord) to enable users to receive personalized notifications.
- **Preview Images**: Creating identifiable proposal preview images at the chain level, making it easier for users to interact with hyperlinks.
- **Anti-Spam Features**: Allowing users to flag spam proposals and comments, with warnings displayed on the UI and moderation team action taken within 24-48 hours.
- **Partnerships**: Integrating the option to build custom quizzes for proposers, collaborating with Proof of Chaos team to reward correct answers with NFTs. Partnering with Grill chat and Subsocial Team to facilitate anonymous on-chain communication.
- **Content & Education**: Establishing a dedicated webpage for blogs, tweets, and digests from Polkassembly to keep users updated on initiatives.
- **Audit**: Creating an audit section for proposals, enabling auditors to reach a wider audience by adding their audit links to proposals.
- **Site-wide Improvements**: Enhancing discussion post linking for better community engagement. Providing edit history for proposals and comments, allowing users to report problematic comments. Adding on-chain events to the calendar, leveraging Polkascan's APIs and allowing filtering by chain level. Enabling image upload in posts and comments for user convenience. Implementing comment sentiment upgrades to view overall sentiment and filter comments accordingly.



The full proposal is available [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_JYFNEV8Y5l5bzs79zD5u--go225vhsfuXuzMNXrDH8/edit).

items.title: OpenComm - The Communication Layer Of Web3 - Milestone 1
items.content:
**TL;DR: Subsocial is consolidating siloed discussions in the ecosystem, as well as enabling users to chat on-chain about any entity or resource, such as proposals, markets, and accounts. This communication layer will be open and accessible by anyone and any application, improving information flow and availability in the ecosystem.**

***

Currently, communication in the Polkadot ecosystem is not only largely stuck in Web2, but it is siloed and segregated. Governance discussions take place off-chain, projects have to rely on Discord and Telegram to interact with their communities, and suboptimal solutions are implemented for connecting these Web2 accounts to users’ Web3 accounts. Furthermore, by forcing communities to live off-chain, user engagement with dapps is lowered.

At Subsocial, we spent three months researching the needs of the ecosystem, and began implementing the foundation for Polkadot’s Open Communication Layer. We realized that, although Web3 communities, and their communications, should be moved on-chain, there was too much friction with actually using a blockchain for this.

To address this problem, we created [Grill.chat](https://grill.chat) as a proof of concept for OpenComm, showing how easy it is for users to start communicating on-chain. The onboarding process is even faster than Web2 apps that we are used to, as you don’t even have to create an account; you just send your first message and an account is automatically generated for you.

With OpenComm, all governance discussions will take place on-chain, and the content and messages will be freely accessible by anyone. This means we could have ten different governance platforms, all connected to the OpenComm social layer, allowing anyone to access the full breadth of Polkadot’s governance discussions, despite their UI/UX preference.

This can be expanded to any project in the ecosystem, and does not apply to just governance discussions. NFT fans could discuss a specific NFT on Singular or Kodadot, accessing a single unified chat from different applications. Sports betters could anonymously discuss Zeitgeist prediction markets on-chain, directly from the PM webpage. Multiple projects are currently working to integrate OpenComm.

Please read the full [proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CEOCnuz9ZAJO0srMQbODWBDtl0p3mzZ5/edit#heading=h.gjdgxs) for all of the relevant details including full context, milestone breakdown, budget, etc.

This topic was previously posted on the [Polkadot Forum](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/an-open-communication-layer-for-polkadot/2842) for some preliminary discussion, but please let us know what you think here.
